name: Maastricht
fun_fact: Fun fact: Maastricht is home to the oldest bookstore in the world that's still in business - Dominicanen, located inside a stunning 13th-century Gothic church, where you can browse books surrounded by soaring vaulted ceilings and original frescoes.

hero_dishes.name: Zuurvlees
hero_dishes.description: Despite its name meaning 'sour meat', this isn't actually sour - it's a slow-cooked beef stew with a delightfully sweet and tangy flavor from a marinade using vinegar and apple butter, served with thick-cut fries
hero_dishes.origin_story: This iconic Limburg dish reflects the region's unique position at the crossroads of Dutch, Belgian, and German culinary traditions, with the apple butter technique dating back centuries to when fruit preservation was essential

hero_dishes.name: Konijn op z'n Limburgs
hero_dishes.description: Rabbit cooked Limburg-style - slowly braised with prunes, gingerbread, and apple syrup creating a rich, savory-sweet masterpiece
hero_dishes.origin_story: This classic preparation showcases the Limburg tradition of combining savory meats with sweet fruit preserves and spiced bread, a culinary practice that goes back to medieval times when monasteries dominated the region
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bistrot-Bar 't Wycker Cabinet, traditional Limburg restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Limburgse Vlaai
hero_dishes.description: A delicate shortcrust pie with various fruit fillings like cherry, apricot, or plum - the pride of Limburg's pastry tradition
hero_dishes.origin_story: Vlaai has been baked in Limburg for over 800 years, with each village developing its own signature filling. It's so important to local culture that it's traditionally served at every celebration
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Local bakeries throughout Maastricht, Caf√© Sjiek

signature_drinks.name: Belgian Specialty Beers
signature_drinks.description: Over 300 varieties of Belgian beers ranging from Trappist ales to lambics
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At De Gouverneur, housed in a former brewery, locals settle in for long evenings sampling rare Belgian beers paired with cheese and charcuterie

signature_drinks.name: Koffie met Vlaai
signature_drinks.description: Strong Dutch coffee paired with a slice of Limburgse Vlaai
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: This is the quintessential Maastricht afternoon ritual - locals take their time over coffee and pie, especially on weekends at traditional caf√©s
